isis.stitle: Recall 98503 - Double Neutral Shift Control Lever on Models with Allison AT545 Automatic Transmissions

recall.subject: Double Neutral Shift Control Lever on Models with Allison AT545 Automatic Transmissions

defect.para: This Recall applies to 1652 SC, 3400, and 4700 models with an AT545 Allison automatic transmission built from 1/1/94 through 7/1/97.

The double neutral shift control lever may bind as the driver attempts to put the lever in the park position. If this occurs, the lever does not actually reach the full park position which could result in a false park condition. If this condition occurs, the parking brake cannot be applied, thus causing the possibility of the vehicle rolling if parked on an incline. This could cause a vehicular accident resulting in property damage or personal injury, or both.

Navistar will notify the involved vehicle owners of this campaign. A listing of owner names and addresses has been furnished to the involved dealers to enable them to follow up with this recall campaign. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

step1.para: Block wheels so the vehicle cannot roll, and place the transmission in the Neutral position.
Remove the 4 mounting screws holding the shift control to the dash brackets.
Remove the shift control from the dash.
Rotate the quadrant downward out of the dash-mounting bracket and disconnect shifter wire harness from the vehicle harness.
Remove shift cable hub mounting hardware from mounting bracket.
Rotate the quadrant until the hairpin cotter is visible. Remove the hairpin cotter and shift cable pivot from the shift handle.
Install the shift cable pivot into the shift handle and install the hairpin cotter.
Rotate the quadrant to install the shift cable mounting hardware to the cable-mounting bracket. Torque at 30 in-lbs.
Install the 4 mounting screws into the dash brackets.
Reconnect the shifter wire harness to the vehicle wire harness.

caution.para: Apply service brakes while verifying the installation.

step1.para: Insure that the engine starts in "P-B" and "Neutral" positions only.
While vehicle is running, see that the reverse switch (if so equipped) signals the back-up lights or alarm as a result of placing shift control in the reverse position.
While vehicle is running, move shift control handle into "P-B" position. The following must occur:

partsinfo.para: Refer to the Vehicle Identification list provided with the paper copy sent to the dealership. Look up the VIN of the vehicle involved and next to the VIN is the part number that is required for correct part installation.

entry.para: Removing and installing of the double neutral shift control

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location. Dearlers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his vehicle as soon as possible.
